title: Campo alla Sughera 2015 Adeo  (Bolgheri)
description: Here's a Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot blend with aromas of ripe red currant, cedar and Mediterranean herb. On the round palate, pliant tannins softly support blueberry jam, tobacco and vanilla.

title: Carpineto 2010 Vigneto Sant'Ercolano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Oak, cassis, prune and forest-floor aromas follow through to the palate along with dried cherry, powdered sage and espresso. Tightly knit astringent tannins clench the finish. Give the tannins several years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Château Monbousquet 2017 Angélique de Monbousquet Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This rich wine has fine tannins, generous spice and crisp acidity that gives a lift to this second wine from Château Monbousquet. Smoky and concentrated, it finishes crisp at the end.

title: Château Caronne Ste Gemme 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Always a reliable property, this estate has produced a wine that is already open and rounded. Its juicy acidity and fine black fruits are on their way, integrating with the wood and developing well. It should be ready to drink from 2022.

title: Château Doyac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. This rounded wine is both full and well structured. Its acidity, black currant fruitiness and background of wood aging are set to age this wine well over the medium term. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Ducluzeau 2017 Barrel Sample  (Listrac-Médoc)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. A generous structure and great blackberry fruit make this a fruity wine. It has soft tannins balanced by bright acidity. It is an easy wine with bright fruits, ready to drink soon.

title: Château Latour Martillac 2017 Barrel Sample  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: 88–90. Barrel Sample. Smoky and tightly mineral, this wine shows solid tannins and a crisp character. There is an herbal hint here, with stalky fruit adding to the fresh character of the wine. Drink from 2022.

title: Château le Chêne 2016  Haut-Médoc
description: This wine, with its exuberant black fruits, is very young. But it is already deliciously fruity, with a backdrop of tannins. The brightness, rich texture, poised acidity and black-currant flavors promise a good future. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Liversan 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This property, now owned by the Antoine Moeuix negociant firm, has made a rich wine with ripe tannins that support the generous black-currant fruits. The structure is dense although there is clear light through the tannins to the fruit. It needs to age further, so drink from 2021.

title: Château Lousteauneuf 2015  Médoc
description: This wine is firm, with a dry core that will take time to soften. But that will happen, because of the ripe black-currant fruit that lies underneath the tannic structure, giving a juicy potential to this rich wine. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Martinat 2014  Côtes de Bourg
description: Packed with red fruits, this wine is bright and crisp, while also having a firm, tannic background. The dense, dusty texture promises a ripe, juicy wine as it ages. Drink this generous wine from 2019.

title: Château Poitevin 2015  Médoc
description: This wine is ripe, juicy and packed with black-currant fruits. Its tannins and wood aging are playing a good supporting role. Generous and full, this juicy wine, from a 61-acre estate, will age well. Drink from 2022.

title: Cave de Cleebourg 2016 Prestige Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Gentle but clean notes of green and yellow pear create an appealing nose. The palate presents the same tones, assisted by lemon brighteness. This is a vivid, fresh and easy wine, with a dry, slender body.

title: Charles Sparr 2016 Collection Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: A rather heady nose of red cherry rises from the glass alongside a note of oak. The palate is fluid and slender, with lovely freshness that frames the heightened tones. The tannins are firm and the finish is refreshing. This needs some time to knit together. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Charles Sparr 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Tart red cherry freshness and a hint of conifer play gently on the nose. The palate brings both these tones to the fore. This is a light-bodied, elegant Pinot Noir for those who like it on the lighter side.

title: Château de Lavagnac 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This ripe wine with red-berry aromas and firm structure is dominated by its 75% Merlot. It is ripe with jammy fruits and a core of tannins. Wood aging has added another attractive dimension to this rich wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Gemeillan 2015  Médoc
description: Vines on this small estate are nearly equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The result is a richly structured wine, full of blackberry and black-plum fruit and generously ripe. The wine has an excellent future, so drink from 2024.

title: Château Jacques Noir 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: From one of the properties owned by the Ducourt family, this wine is structured and firm. It also has juicy fruit, rich tannins and plenty of crisp acidity, with a touch of spice from wood aging. With its firm tannins, it needs to age, so drink from 2021.

title: Château la Tonnelle 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Situated in the north of the Haut-Médoc, close to Saint-Estèphe, this vineyard has been owned by the Fabre family since 1982. This vintage is rich, with an interesting proportion of Petit Verdot in the blend to give color and structure. It's ripe with black-currant and berry fruits, with a firm aftertaste. Drink from 2022.

title: Abacela 2014 Barrel Select Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: The Tempranillos from this pioneering estate winery bring deep dense purple fruits, along with very potent flavors of vanilla, black tea and coffee liqueur. Tannic and earthy, this has a somewhat grainy mouthfeel. It's packed with flavor, but with less emphasis on pure fruit and more on the vanilla-laced tannins.

title: Amalie Robert 2013 Wadenswil Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Despite its remarkably low alcohol, this well-made wine broadly displays flavors of nectarine, pie cherry and chocolate. As expected, there is ample acidity, but not too much to turn the whole thing sour. Just two barrels were produced, one new and one neutral.

title: Antico Colle 2015  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
description: Inviting aromas of wild dark-skinned berry, chopped mint and forest floor unfold in the glass. The enjoyable palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, white pepper and a hint of salty mineral alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Banfi 2014 Aska  (Bolgheri)
description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this evokes aromas of spiced blueberry, baking spice and a hint of mocha. The savory palate offers black-currant jam, licorice and a touch of cocoa alongside polished tannins.

title: Bellavista 2013 Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of toast and dried apricot carry over to the linear palate along with candied tangerine zest and a note of bitter walnut. Lively bubbles provide the backdrop.

title: Bodega Classica 2014 Hacienda Lopez de Haro Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Savory aromas of medicinal oak combined with spicy, minty berry and cherry scents make for a good opening. A fairly full palate is balanced by healthy acidity, while this wine tastes of plum, berry fruits, vanilla and tobacco. A solid finish with nothing extreme is the final seal.

title: Clos Berenguer del Molar 2015 Clos de Tafall Red (Priorat)
description: Ripe earthy aromas of berry fruits, compost and cheesy oak are disparate but good. A raw, grabby palate is bumpy as it deals flavors of berry fruits, cassis and aged cheese. While the finish lacks total harmony, this wine has enough power and quality of flavors to continue on.

title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Tradition Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: A hint of pear drop plays amidst the lemon scent. It is the lemon freshness that takes over on the palate which is supremely light and fresh. This freshness rings right through to the dry finish.

title: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Rouge des 2 Cerfs Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Hints of ripe red cherry and tart Morello combine on the nose. The palate is light but has a frame of fine tannins. Freshness and lightness are the chief attractions here, with conifer in the background. Overall a light, traditional, savory Pinot.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: One of the finer Oregon Gamays, this deeply-colored wine is spicy and rich, from first sniff through the last sip. Intense aromas of clove and cranberry come up first and continue into the core flavors, along with fruit leather and orange peel.

title: Estrin 2014 Big Tree Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon (59%) and Syrah (33%) make up the majority of this wine, which is finished off with Merlot. Aromas of woodspice, herb, licorice and cherry lead to full-bodied cherry and cranberry flavors. It shows focus and intensity.
